intro: Chaerophyllum ramosum, commonly known as the branched hogweed, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it blooms from late spring to early summer.
